title: A bifunctional film based on carboxymethyl cellulose/polyvinyl alcohol integrated with anthocyanins doped zeolitic imidazolate framework-8 for monitoring and maintaining fruit freshness.
abstract: The development of eco-friendly and smart packaging materials is of great importance in food safety. Herein, a bifunctional composite film (Ant@ZIF-8/CP) for freshness monitoring and quality preservation of fruit was fabricated by anthocyanins doped ZIF-8 as additive and carboxymethyl cellulose/polyvinyl alcohol as matrix. The incorporation of Ant@ZIF-8 enhanced the mechanical properties, hydrophobicity, and gas-barrier capacity of the film. The ultimate tensile strength and elongation at break of Ant@ZIF-8/CP film were 13.97 MPa and 32.96 %, respectively. The Ant@ZIF-8/CP film exhibited an excellent colorimetric response, antibacterial activity, and biodegradability. The inhibition zone against E. coli of Ant@ZIF-8/CP film was 2.42 mm. The obvious color change of Ant@ZIF-8/CP film after storing the grapes was due to the structure transformation of anthocyanins under acidic conditions. Zinc ions released from Ant@ZIF-8 inhibited the growth of bacteria, thereby maintaining the quality of grapes. This work presents a promising film for prolonging food shelf life and monitoring food freshness.
